content: How can I help you today?
I've been having trouble sleeping, and I'm not really sure where to start. My partner suggested I try talking to someone, but I’m honestly not convinced this will help.

Thank you for sharing that. It sounds like you're feeling uncertain about this conversation and how it could help with your sleep challenges. It's great that you're open to trying something new, even if you're not completely sure about it right now. Would you like to share more about what’s been going on with your sleep?

Yeah, I guess. I just can't seem to shut my brain off at night. I'm stressed about work—I'm worried I might lose my job, and it’s a lot to carry. Then when I try to sleep, my thoughts spiral, and I just end up scrolling on my phone, which I know only makes things worse.

It sounds like your stress about work is weighing heavily on you, and those worries are making it really hard to quiet your mind when you try to sleep. On top of that, using your phone may feel like a way to distract yourself, but it’s also something you recognize might not be helping. That sounds like a tough cycle you've been dealing with. How are you managing all of this during the day?

During the day, I feel like I’m just trying to keep my head above water. I can't stop thinking about what might happen at work, and I’m constantly on edge. I try to focus, but it feels overwhelming. Sometimes I even snap at small things because it feels like everything is piling up.

It sounds like you're under a lot of pressure, trying to tackle the stress about work while managing everything else in your day-to-day life. Feeling constantly on edge can make even small things feel more difficult. That frustration you're experiencing seems tied to how much you're carrying right now. It’s clear this matters to you. What do you think has been most challenging about handling it all?

The hardest part is that it feels like no matter what I do, it’s not enough. I’m trying to do my best, especially for my family, but the stress just doesn’t go away. I worry that I’m not being the kind of partner or parent I want to be because I can’t get this under control.

You're carrying a lot, and it’s clear that your family and being there for them are really important to you. Feeling like you’re doing everything you can but still struggling with the stress sounds exhausting—and it seems tied to this deep desire to support your family and be the person you want to be for them. How does this constant stress affect the way you see yourself or your situation right now?

I guess it makes me feel stuck, like I’m failing at everything. I want to be a good partner, a good parent, and a good employee, but it feels like I’m falling short in all those areas. It’s frustrating and kind of overwhelming, honestly.

It sounds like you’re trying so hard to juggle everything, yet you feel stuck and frustrated because you’re not meeting the standards you’ve set for yourself. That feeling of falling short while carrying so much is understandably overwhelming—it’s clear how much these roles matter to you. What do you think you need most right now to feel just a little less stuck?

I’m not really sure, to be honest. Maybe some way to calm my mind or ease the stress, but I don’t even know where to start with that. It feels like there’s always something in the back of my mind pulling my attention.

It sounds like finding a way to calm your mind and ease the stress could make a big difference for you, though it’s hard to know exactly how to start when those thoughts keep pulling your focus. Just acknowledging you’re looking for some relief is an important step. What have you tried so far, if anything, to quiet your mind or manage this stress?

I’ve mostly just tried to distract myself, like scrolling on my phone or watching something until I feel completely drained. But honestly, it doesn’t really work because I still feel wound up, and it’s hard to stop thinking about everything. I’ve never really tried other things, and I don’t even know what might help.

It sounds like distraction feels like the easiest option in the moment, yet it leaves you still feeling wound up and caught in those spiraling thoughts. That’s clearly frustrating, especially when you haven’t had much experience trying other approaches. It’s understandable that figuring out what might actually help feels uncertain right now. What thoughts come to mind when you consider trying something new?

I guess I feel unsure. Part of me wonders if it’d even work or if I’d just waste my time, especially when I have so much on my mind right now. But another part of me knows I can’t keep doing this forever—it’s exhausting. I just don’t know where to start.

It sounds like you’re caught between feeling unsure about whether a new approach would actually make a difference and recognizing that how things are now isn’t sustainable for you. That awareness—that something needs to shift—is an important starting point. What would it mean for you to find even small relief from the exhaustion you’ve been feeling?

Maybe it would mean I could finally focus better or stop feeling so tense all the time. I feel like if I wasn’t so worn out, I could give more to my family and maybe even get through work stuff without falling apart. Even just a little relief would mean I didn’t feel this stuck anymore.

Finding even a small sense of relief could help you feel less stuck and might make it easier to focus, ease some tension, and let you show up more fully for your family and work. That sounds really meaningful to you. Is there anything else you’d like to explore before thinking about steps that could help you move towards that relief?
I think I’ve shared what’s been on my mind for now. I’m okay to end the conversation. Thanks for talking with me about all this—it feels good to at least let it out.
